file_content.text: The Ortolans have returned to their homes now. I suppose they'll just have to try to move on with their lives.
You're back! I hope the Ortolans are okay.
I got them all out. The mission was a success.
The Ortolans are safe.
I got the Ortolans out and made sure the Gen'Dai saw the error of their ways.
The pirates suffered.
Excellent. They deserve everything they got.
The Gen'Dai were tough.
But you beat them--that's all that matters.
If you hadn't done anything, the Bala D'ur would have carried on until they wiped out the entire Ortolan population.
Their colonies are small and gentle. They deserve our protection.
Have you rescued the Ortolans yet?
Captain, I was told you needed a freelancer, but I wouldn't rescue my own mother for that kind of money.
Just because the Ortolans keep to themselves, you think they don't deserve our help?
You've got the wrong guy. But ask them--from what I hear, they love suicide missions.
You've got the wrong guy. But ask the Jedi--they love suicide missions.
You've got the wrong guy. Maybe check with the fancy privateer--I've heard his rates are pretty low, when he remembers to charge.
You've got the wrong guy. Maybe check with the fancy privateer--I've heard her rates are pretty low, when she remembers to charge.
You've got the wrong guy. But it looks like your lucky day--those Special Ops kids love suicide missions.
You've got the wrong guy. But ask her. If what I hear is true, she'll probably do it for nothing.
You've got the wrong guy. But ask him. If what I hear is true, he'll probably do it for nothing.
Coward. Sorry. I'm desperate to find someone to stop the Bala D'ur. They're feeding Ortolans to their wampas. What's next--children?
Are you serious? Someone's feeding Ortolans to the local wildlife?
Feeding people to wampas?
Yes! They're trying to turn the wampas into... I don't know what.
Who are these Bala D'ur?
The Bala-who?
Come now. No one's feeding anyone to wampas.
Stop being melodramatic.
I wish that were the case.
The Bala D'ur are pirates. They're kidnapping Ortolans, forcing them into salvage retrieval. When the Ortolans die, they just toss the bodies to the animals.
Everyone's too scared to do anything about it. The pirates--they're Gen'Dai. Notoriously hard to fight.
Why are Gen'Dai so hard to bring down?
What makes them so tough?
I'm sure I can find a way.
Your confidence is certainly refreshing. But I'm not kidding around here.
Why are you asking me for help? You have the whole army behind you.
This isn't my problem.
Uh-uh--my commander doesn't know if we can beat them and he doesn't want to embarrass the Republic. Pathetic.
The Gen'Dai have the ability to regenerate body parts. They can withstand a lot of punishment and keep going.
But someone has to rescue the Ortolans! They're peaceful and... short, and the Bala D'ur are killing them.
I will rescue the Ortolans for you.
This is an outrage.
I'll rescue the Ortolans and make sure these pirates see the error of their ways.
I'll rescue them.
Can't stand cruelty. I'll get them out of there.
Count me in.
I will represent the Republic in this cause. Consider the Ortolans freed.
I'll put a stop to this.
Finally! Someone willing to do the right thing!
These Gen'Dai sound tough.
Just concentrate on freeing the Ortolans and you should be fine.
The headquarters of the Bala D'ur is far out in the ice field. Good luck to you.
Can't help you. [Refuse quest]
So you're no better than anyone else I've spoken to--content to let innocents die. Goodbye, then.
I can't talk right now. I'm in the middle of negotiations.
